text: George Washington was the first president of the United States.
The Treaty of Paris was an agreement signed by British and American leaders that stated the United States of America was a free and independent country.
The Puritans were an English religious sect who hoped to 'purify' the Anglican church of Roman Catholic traces in practice & organization.
In 1807, the Embargo Act prohibited all foreign trade.
The Great War was the term used to describe World War I at the time of the war.
Thomas Edison is credited with the invention of the incandescent lightbulb.
